rsuanalyzer.calc_rsu package#

Submodules#

rsuanalyzer.calc_rsu.chain module#

Functions for calculating the distance between the ends of chains.

rsuanalyzer.calc_rsu.chain.calc_chain_end_dist(conf_id: str, theta: float, delta_: float) → float#

Calculate the distance between the two ends of the chain.

Parameters:

  • conf_id (str) – Conformation ID of the chain, e.g., “RRFFRL”.

  • theta (float) – Tilting angle of the two C-C bonds in the ligand

  • 90. (in degrees. 0 <= theta <=) –

  • delta (float) – Angle in degrees. 0 < delta_ <= 180.

Returns:

The distance between the two ends of the chain.

Return type:

float

rsuanalyzer.calc_rsu.chain.calc_global_lig_ends_in_chain(conf_id: str, theta: float, delta_: float) → list[tuple[ndarray, Rotation]]#

Calculate the positions and rotations of the ends of the ligands in the chain measured from the global coordinate system.

Parameters:

  • conf_id (str) – Conformation ID of the chain, e.g., “RRFFRL”.

  • theta (float) – Tilting angle of the two C-C bonds in the ligand

  • 90. (in degrees. 0 <= theta <=) –

  • delta (float) – Angle in degrees. 0 < delta_ <= 180.

Returns:

The list of tuples, each of which contains the position and the rotation of the end of a ligand measured from the global coordinate system.

Return type:

list[tuple[np.ndarray, R]]

rsuanalyzer.calc_rsu.conf_id_to_lig_and_types module#

Functions to extract ligand types and connection types from a conformation ID.

rsuanalyzer.calc_rsu.conf_id_to_lig_and_types.conf_id_to_con_types(conf_id: str) → list[str]#

Extract the connection types from the conformation ID.

Parameters:

conf_id (str) – Conformation ID of the chain or ring.

Returns:

Connection types.

Return type:

list[str]

Examples

>>> conf_id_to_lig_types("RRFFLL")  # chain
["FF"]
>>> conf_id_to_lig_types("RRFFLLBB")  # ring
["FF", "BB"]
rsuanalyzer.calc_rsu.conf_id_to_lig_and_types.conf_id_to_lig_types(conf_id: str) → list[str]#

Extract the ligand types from the conformation ID.

Parameters:

conf_id (str) – Conformation ID of the chain or ring.

Returns:

Ligand types.

Return type:

list[str]

Examples

>>> conf_id_to_lig_types("RRFFLL")  # chain
["RR", "LL"]
>>> conf_id_to_lig_types("RRFFLLBB")  # ring
["RR", "LL"]

rsuanalyzer.calc_rsu.connection module#

Functions to calculate the rotation for connection on metal

rsuanalyzer.calc_rsu.connection.rot_ca(con_type: Literal['FF', 'FB', 'BF', 'BB'], delta_: float) → Rotation#

Calculate the rotation for connection on metal.

Rotation from the coordinate system C of the current ligand to the coordinate system A of the next ligand is calculated. For more detailed definitions, see the associated paper.

Parameters:

  • con_type (Literal["FF", "FB", "BF", "BB"]) – Connection type.

  • delta (float) – N-M-N angle in degrees. 0 < delta_ <= 180.

Returns:

The rotation from the coordinate system C of the current ligand to the coordinate system A of the next ligand.

Return type:

R

rsuanalyzer.calc_rsu.ligand module#

Functions to calculate vectors and rotations for the ligand.

Model ligand has points A, B, and C, and the coordinate systems A, B1, B2, and C; this module provides functions to calculate the vectors between the points and the rotations between the coordinate systems.

For more detailed definitions, see the associated paper.

rsuanalyzer.calc_rsu.ligand.rot_ab1(lig_type: Literal['RR', 'RL', 'LR', 'LL'], theta: float) → Rotation#

Calculate the rotation from the coordinate system A to B1.

For the definitions of the points and the coordinate systems, see the associated paper.

rsuanalyzer.calc_rsu.ligand.rot_ac(lig_type: Literal['RR', 'RL', 'LR', 'LL'], theta: float) → Rotation#

Calculate the rotation from the coordinate system A to C.

For the definitions of the points and the coordinate systems, see the associated paper.

rsuanalyzer.calc_rsu.ligand.x_ab_coord_a(lig_type: Literal['RR', 'RL', 'LR', 'LL'], theta: float) → ndarray#

Calculate the vector AB in the coordinate system A.

For the definitions of the points and the coordinate systems, see the associated paper.

rsuanalyzer.calc_rsu.ligand.x_ac_coord_a(lig_type: Literal['RR', 'RL', 'LR', 'LL'], theta: float) → ndarray#

Calculate the vector AC in the coordinate system A.

For the definitions of the points and the coordinate systems, see the associated paper.

rsuanalyzer.calc_rsu.ligand.x_bc_coord_a(lig_type: Literal['RR', 'RL', 'LR', 'LL'], theta: float) → ndarray#

Calculate the vector BC in the coordinate system A.

For the definitions of the points and the coordinate systems, see the associated paper.

rsuanalyzer.calc_rsu.rsu module#

Calculate the “Ring Strain per Unit” (RSU) for a ring.

rsuanalyzer.calc_rsu.rsu.calc_rsu(conf_id_of_ring: str, theta: float, delta_: float) → float#

Calculate the “Ring Strain per Unit” (RSU) for a ring.

RSU is a measure of the strain of a ring. It is calculated as the [average distance]/[number of chains] where the average distance is the average of the distances between the ends of the chains derived from the ring by cutting at different points. For more details, see the associated paper.

Parameters:

  • conf_id_of_ring (str) – Conformation ID of the ring. e.g., “RRFFLLBB”.

  • theta (float) – Tilting angle of the two C-C bonds in the ligand in degrees. 0 <= theta <= 90.

  • delta (float) – Angle in degrees. 0 < delta_ <= 180.

Returns:

The RSU for the ring.

Return type:

float
